summary: M. Michael Massumi, M.D., faced disciplinary action for violating prior probationary conditions and failing to meet appropriate standards for medical care, primarily concerning inappropriate opioid prescribing and inadequate monitoring of patient urine drug screens. His medical license was suspended for 90 days, effective January 1, 2016, followed by a minimum three-year probation. Conditions of probation include opioid prescribing coursework and mandatory use of the Prescription Drug Monitoring Program.
